headline: SAN FRANCISCO SUPERVISORS DEMAND AMAZON BARGAIN WITH THE TEAMSTERS
summary: The San Francisco Board of Supervisors unanimously passed a resolution today demanding that Amazon immediately begin bargaining with more than 100 warehouse workers and drivers at the company's DCK6 facility. The vote followed a rally and intense advocacy by Amazon Teamsters calling out the company's ongoing refusal to recognize the union.

headline: JBG SMITH Declares a Quarterly Common Dividend of $0.175 Per Share
summary: BETHESDA, Md., December 16, 2025--JBG SMITH (NYSE: JBGS), a leading owner, operator, and developer of mixed-use properties in the Washington, DC market, today announced that its Board of Trustees has declared a quarterly dividend of $0.175 per common share. The dividend will be paid on January 13, 2026 to common shareholders of record as of December 30, 2025.

The dividend will be paid on January 13, 2026 to common shareholders of record as of December 30, 2025.

headline: US Threatens to Retaliate Against EU Firms Over Digital Tax
summary: “If the EU and EU Member States insist on continuing to restrict, limit, and deter the competitiveness of U.S. service providers through discriminatory means, the United States will have no choice but to begin using every tool at its disposal to counter these unreasonable measures,” the Office of the US Trade Representative said in a social media post on Tuesday.  The USTR named several other European companies, including DHL Group, SAP SE, Amadeus IT Group SA, Capgemini SE, Publicis Groupe and Mistral AI, which it said have enjoyed unfettered access to the US market for years.

raw.headline: US Threatens to Retaliate Against EU Firms Over Digital Tax
raw.summary: “If the EU and EU Member States insist on continuing to restrict, limit, and deter the competitiveness of U.S. service providers through discriminatory means, the United States will have no choice but to begin using every tool at its disposal to counter these unreasonable measures,” the Office of the US Trade Representative said in a social media post on Tuesday.  The USTR named several other European companies, including DHL Group, SAP SE, Amadeus IT Group SA, Capgemini SE, Publicis Groupe and Mistral AI, which it said have enjoyed unfettered access to the US market for years.

headline: Instagram Debuts Dedicated Television App for Amazon Fire TV
summary: The app will initially launch on Amazon.com Inc.’s Fire TV platform, the company said Tuesday, describing the offering as a test.  Instagram boss Adam Mosseri hinted at a TV app from the stage at Bloomberg’s Screentime conference in Los Angeles in October.  If people are consuming social media platforms on television, “then we need to move to TV, too,” Mosseri said at the time.

headline: 2025: The year that the robotaxi went mainstream with Waymo leading the pack
summary: Alphabet's Waymo scaled up in 2025 and leads the American robotaxi market by far, while Baidu’s Apollo Go dominated in China. In San Francisco, Zoox, Tesla and Waymo are all revving up their offerings, though Waymo is the only one there that provides driverless rides in a widely available commercial service. After more than a decade of promises from CEO Elon Musk, Tesla finally launched a Robotaxi app, but its ride-hail cars still have human supervisors on board ready to take over the wheel.
